segments.pli: Aṅguttara Nikāya 3
segments.en: Numbered Discourses 3

segments.pli: 3. Puggalavagga
segments.en: 3. Persons

segments.pli: 27. Jigucchitabbasutta
segments.en: 27. Offensive

segments.pli: “Tayome, bhikkhave, puggalā santo saṃvijjamānā lokasmiṃ.
segments.en: “These three people are found in the world.

segments.pli: Katame tayo?
segments.en: What three?

segments.pli: Atthi, bhikkhave, puggalo jigucchitabbo na sevitabbo na bhajitabbo na payirupāsitabbo.
segments.en: There is a person who you should be disgusted by, and you shouldn’t associate with, accompany, or attend them.

segments.pli: Atthi, bhikkhave, puggalo ajjhupekkhitabbo na sevitabbo na bhajitabbo na payirupāsitabbo.
segments.en: There is a person you should regard with equanimity, and you shouldn’t associate with, accompany, or attend them.

segments.pli: Atthi, bhikkhave, puggalo sevitabbo bhajitabbo payirupāsitabbo.
segments.en: There is a person you should associate with, accompany, and attend.

segments.pli: Katamo ca, bhikkhave, puggalo jigucchitabbo na sevitabbo na bhajitabbo na payirupāsitabbo?
segments.en: Who is the person you should be disgusted by, and not associate with, accompany, or attend?

segments.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, ekacco puggalo dussīlo hoti pāpadhammo asuci saṅkassarasamācāro paṭicchannakammanto, assamaṇo samaṇapaṭiñño, abrahmacārī brahmacāripaṭiñño, antopūti avassuto kasambujāto.
segments.en: It’s a person who is unethical, of bad qualities, filthy, with suspicious behavior, underhand, no true ascetic or spiritual practitioner—though claiming to be one—rotten inside, corrupt, and depraved.

segments.pli: Evarūpo, bhikkhave, puggalo jigucchitabbo na sevitabbo na bhajitabbo na payirupāsitabbo.
segments.en: You should be disgusted by such a person, and you shouldn’t associate with, accompany, or attend them.

segments.pli: Taṃ kissa hetu?
segments.en: Why is that?

segments.pli: Kiñcāpi, bhikkhave, evarūpassa puggalassa na diṭṭhānugatiṃ āpajjati, atha kho naṃ pāpako kittisaddo abbhuggacchati:
segments.en: Even if you don’t follow the example of such a person, you still get a bad reputation:

segments.pli: ‘pāpamitto purisapuggalo pāpasahāyo pāpasampavaṅko’ti.
segments.en: ‘That individual has bad friends, companions, and associates.’

segments.pli: Seyyathāpi, bhikkhave, ahi gūthagato kiñcāpi na daṃsati, atha kho naṃ makkheti;
segments.en: They’re like a snake that’s been living in a pile of dung. Even if it doesn’t bite, it’ll still rub off on you.

segments.pli: evamevaṃ kho, bhikkhave, kiñcāpi evarūpassa puggalassa na diṭṭhānugatiṃ āpajjati, atha kho naṃ pāpako kittisaddo abbhuggacchati:
segments.en: In the same way, even if you don’t follow the example of such a person, you still get a bad reputation:

segments.pli: ‘pāpamitto purisapuggalo pāpasahāyo pāpasampavaṅko’ti.
segments.en: ‘That individual has bad friends, companions, and associates.’

segments.pli: Tasmā evarūpo puggalo jigucchitabbo na sevitabbo na bhajitabbo na payirupāsitabbo.
segments.en: That’s why you should be disgusted by such a person, and you shouldn’t associate with, accompany, or attend them.

segments.pli: Katamo ca, bhikkhave, puggalo ajjhupekkhitabbo na sevitabbo na bhajitabbo na payirupāsitabbo?
segments.en: Who is the person you should regard with equanimity, and not associate with, accompany, or attend?

segments.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, ekacco puggalo kodhano hoti upāyāsabahulo,
segments.en: It’s a person who is irritable and bad-tempered.

segments.pli: appampi vutto samāno abhisajjati kuppati byāpajjati patitthīyati, kopañca dosañca appaccayañca pātukaroti.
segments.en: Even when lightly criticized they lose their temper, becoming annoyed, hostile, and hard-hearted, and they display annoyance, hate, and bitterness.

segments.pli: Seyyathāpi, bhikkhave, duṭṭhāruko kaṭṭhena vā kaṭhalāya vā ghaṭṭito bhiyyoso mattāya āsavaṃ deti;
segments.en: They’re like a festering sore, which, when you hit it with a stick or a stone, discharges even more.

segments.pli: evamevaṃ kho, bhikkhave … pe …
segments.en: In the same way, someone is irritable and bad-tempered.

segments.pli: seyyathāpi, bhikkhave, tindukālātaṃ kaṭṭhena vā kaṭhalāya vā ghaṭṭitaṃ bhiyyoso mattāya cicciṭāyati ciṭiciṭāyati;
segments.en: They’re like a firebrand of pale-moon ebony, which, when you hit it with a stick or a stone, sizzles and crackles even more.

segments.pli: evamevaṃ kho, bhikkhave … pe …
segments.en: In the same way, someone is irritable and bad-tempered.

segments.pli: seyyathāpi, bhikkhave, gūthakūpo kaṭṭhena vā kaṭhalāya vā ghaṭṭito bhiyyoso mattāya duggandho hoti;
segments.en: They’re like a sewer, which, when you stir it with a stick or a stone, stinks even more.

segments.pli: evamevaṃ kho, bhikkhave, idhekacco puggalo kodhano hoti upāyāsabahulo,
segments.en: In the same way, someone is irritable and bad-tempered.

segments.pli: appampi vutto samāno abhisajjati kuppati byāpajjati patitthīyati, kopañca dosañca appaccayañca pātukaroti.
segments.en: Even when lightly criticized they lose their temper, becoming annoyed, hostile, and hard-hearted, and they display annoyance, hate, and bitterness.

segments.pli: Evarūpo, bhikkhave, puggalo ajjhupekkhitabbo na sevitabbo na bhajitabbo na payirupāsitabbo.
segments.en: You should regard such a person with equanimity, and you shouldn’t associate with, accompany, or attend them.

segments.pli: Taṃ kissa hetu?
segments.en: Why is that?

segments.pli: Akkoseyyapi maṃ paribhāseyyapi maṃ anatthampi maṃ kareyyāti.
segments.en: Thinking, ‘They might abuse or insult me, or do me harm.’

segments.pli: Tasmā evarūpo puggalo ajjhupekkhitabbo na sevitabbo na bhajitabbo na payirupāsitabbo.
segments.en: That’s why you should regard such a person with equanimity, and you shouldn’t associate with, accompany, or attend them.

segments.pli: Katamo ca, bhikkhave, puggalo sevitabbo bhajitabbo payirupāsitabbo?
segments.en: Who is the person you should associate with, accompany, and attend?

segments.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, ekacco puggalo sīlavā hoti kalyāṇadhammo.
segments.en: It’s someone who is ethical, of good character.

segments.pli: Evarūpo, bhikkhave, puggalo sevitabbo bhajitabbo payirupāsitabbo.
segments.en: You should associate with, accompany, and attend such a person.

segments.pli: Taṃ kissa hetu?
segments.en: Why is that?

segments.pli: Kiñcāpi, bhikkhave, evarūpassa puggalassa na diṭṭhānugatiṃ āpajjati, atha kho naṃ kalyāṇo kittisaddo abbhuggacchati:
segments.en: Even if you don’t follow the example of such a person, you still get a good reputation:

segments.pli: ‘kalyāṇamitto purisapuggalo kalyāṇasahāyo kalyāṇasampavaṅko’ti.
segments.en: ‘That individual has good friends, companions, and associates.’

segments.pli: Tasmā evarūpo puggalo sevitabbo bhajitabbo payirupāsitabbo.
segments.en: That’s why you should associate with, accompany, and attend such a person.

segments.pli: Ime kho, bhikkhave, tayo puggalā santo saṃvijjamānā lokasminti.
segments.en: These are the three people found in the world.

segments.pli: Nihīyati puriso nihīnasevī,
segments.en: A man who associates with an inferior goes downhill,

segments.pli: Na ca hāyetha kadāci tulyasevī;
segments.en: but associating with an equal, you’ll never decline;

segments.pli: Seṭṭhamupanamaṃ udeti khippaṃ,
segments.en: following the best, you’ll quickly rise up,

segments.pli: Tasmā attano uttariṃ bhajethā”ti.
segments.en: so you should keep company with people better than you.”

segments.pli: Sattamaṃ.

sections.title: “These three people are found in the world.

suttaplex.blurb: Who to associate with, and who to shun.
